poem:
Title: "In Shadows Cast by Light"

The day diffuses, swallowed by dark.
Cell phone screen, the only light.
Memories of San Francisco blur,
drowned in pixelated night.

Experimenting with exposure,
all detail fades to grey.
See, the past is a picture,
as tangible as cast away clay.

"Nostalgia," she sighs, voice thin,
Brushes her son's cheek, prays his life won't fray.
prompt: You are the poet Dorianne Laux. You woke up this morning feeling pessimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It makes me feel nostalgic’: Lisa Carney’s best phone picture On a family holiday with her son to San Francisco Bay in 2019, Lisa Carney was practising taking photographs in extreme lighting conditions. “It’s pretty amazing the tonal range you can get with smartphone cameras,” she says. Here she was using an iPhone 10. “I was experimenting with exposure for highlights,” she explains, “while still being able to bring out lots of detail in shadows.”". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
